summary.Title: Developer with test development and test setup experience
summary.JobHeadline: Developer with test development and test setup experience
summary.Presentation:

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Developer with test development and test setup experience
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you looking to reduce the climate impact of agriculture by promoting mechanical weed control?

 

Do you find yourself at home in the intersection between product development, test and validation on system level?

 

Then CLAAS E-Systems is the right place for you, as they are searching for a new Developer.

 

About the job:

CLAAS’ innovative vision-based system comprises cameras, control units, actuators and feedback sensors and allows precise in-row mechanical weeding in difficult conditions.

 

In your role as Developer, you will play a key role in extending CLAAS’ testing capabilities; driving collection and analysis of data collected from systems in the field and contributing to the expansion of their growing product portfolio.

 

You will get firsthand experience with the challenges met when vision-based sensing is applied to real-life agricultural tasks and by doing so help improve performance and quality of existing as well as new products.

 

You will be interacting with technologies and frameworks such as C/C++, Python, MATLAB, CAN, ISOBUS, GPS, Git, AWS etc.

 

Your responsibilities:

  • Development and maintenance of manual and automated tests and test setups
  • Collection, mapping and analysis of performance data from systems in the field
  • Development of software components in C/C++, MATLAB and Python for embedded devices
  • Implementation and adaptation of serial communication functionality using ISOBUS or CAN
  • Build and release of software packages for integration at CLAAS’ customers
  • Benchmarking of system performance
  • Participation in field-tests at CLAAS’ customers, both nationally and internationally
  • Consultation with internal stakeholders to determine the scope of and requirements to development projects

 

Your qualifications:

  • B.Sc., M.Sc. or similar degree in technical engineering
  • Experience with manual and automated testing on component, sub-system or system level
  • Good understanding of system interactions and feedback loops with respect to mechanics, electronics, hydraulics and sensing components
  • Experience with versioning control using Git
  • Experience with release management
  • Experience with development and maintenance of software on embedded devices using C/C++ or Python
  • Experience with development and maintenance of software MATLAB
  • Knowledge of optical sensor technologies such as camera, LIDAR or radar considered a plus

 

As a person you are:

  • Structured and with good sense of detail
  • Quality conscious
  • Innovative, curious and entrepreneurial
  • A team player, yet able to take on tasks alone
  • Able to understand complex problems and system interactions
  • Able to pick the right tool for each assignment
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills
  • Comfortable with SCRUM as working principle
  • Fluent in speech and writing in Danish and English
  • Residing in Denmark or Europe, having a valid work & resident permit and ready to relocate to Denmark

 

Since CLAAS’ headquarter is located in Dissen am Teutoburger Wald in Germany, you should expect limited travel activities from time to time.

About the CLAAS Group and CLAAS E-Systems

The CLAAS Group is one of the world's leading manufacturers of agricultural technology. Its modern and innovative harvesting machines, tractors, balers and agricultural information technologies help to meet the ever-increasing demand for food, energy and raw materials.

 

CLAAS employs around 11,500 employees worldwide and reported a turnover of beyond € 4.0 billion in 2020. The company was founded by the CLAAS brothers in 1913 and is still – more than 100 years later – family-owned.

 

CLAAS E-Systems is the integrated CLAAS Group partner for electronics and electrical systems. More than 250 employees develop innovative, intelligent software, sensor systems and machine components to increase efficiency in agriculture through automation and optimization. Claas’ Danish department in Nivå specializes in machine vision and has more than 20 years of experience in this field.

 

For additional information, please visit http://www.claas-e-systems.com.

Interested?

The recruitment process is handled by mpeople on behalf of CLAAS. If you have any questions about the position or CLAAS, please get in touch with Birgitte Vilsgaard on bgv@mpeople.dk or +45 28 18 18 91.

We look forward to hearing from you.
